channel.title: Java Operators and how they are used in the server
channel.description:
[b]Purpose;[/b] To teach you about the Java Operators and how they can be used in your server.
[b]Difficulty;[/b]0/10
[hr]
Well, Lets get started shall we.
[b]Simple Assignment Operator[/b]
[ul][li]= Equals[/li][/ul]
How we can use this in a server.
public int example[b] = [/b]0;
[hr]
[b]Arithmetic Operators[/b]
[ul][li]+ Add[/li] [li]- Subtract[/li] [li]* Multiply[/li] [li]/ Divide[/li][/ul]
[b]How we use them in a serve[/b]r.
[code]p2.example += 1;[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This would add 1 to the int example making it change from 0-1 or 1-2 Ect
[code]p2.example -= 1;[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This would subtract 1 away from int example making it change from 2-1 or 1-0
[code]p2.example *= 2;[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This would multiply the current number in 'int example' by 2 changing it from 5-10 or 10-20
[code]p2.example /= 2;[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This would divide the current number in 'int Example' by 2, changing it from 20-10 or 10-5
[hr]
[b]Equality and Relational Operators[/b]
[ul][li]== Equal To[/li] [li]!= Not Equal To[/li] [li]> Greater Than[/li] [li]>= Greater Than or Equal To[/li] [li]< Less Than[/li] [li]<= Less than or Equal To[/li][/ul]
[b]How they can be used in a server[/b]
[code]else if (p.example == 1);[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This means if something is equal to something else.. so if p.example is 1
[code]else if (p.example != 1);[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This means if something is not equal to something else... So if p.example is [b]NOT[/b] 1.
[code]else if (p.example >= 1);[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This means if something is More than or Equal to something... so if p.example is 1 or more
[code]else if (p.example > 1);[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This means if something is more than something... so if p.example is more than 1.
[code]else if (p.example < 3;[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This means if something is less than something... so if p.example is less than 3
[code]else if (p.example <= 3);[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This means if something is less than or equal to something... so if p.example is 3 or less.
[hr]
[b]Conditional Operators[/b]
[ul][li]&& Conditional-AND[/li] [li]|| Conditional-OR[/li] [li]?: Ternary[/li][/ul]
[b]How they can be used in a server.[/b]
[code]else if (p.example == 1) && (p.example1 == 2)[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This means if something is something [b]and[/b] something else is something.. so if p.example is 1 and p.example1 is 2
[code]else if (p.example == 1) || (p.example1 == 2)[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This means if something is something [b]or[/b] something else is something.. so if p example is 1 or p.example1 is 2
[code]String example() { return playerName ? "yes" : "no"; }[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] This is a shorthand method for an If statement. but can only have one input, So if something is example it will be either yes or no.
[hr]
[b]BitShift Operators[/b]
[ul][li]<< Signed left shift[/li] [li]>> Signed right shift[/li] [li]>>> Unsigned Right shift[/li][/ul]
[b]How they can be used in a server[/b]
[code]void example() { absX = absY >> 3; sendMessage(absX); }[/code] [b]Explanation;[/b] a Bitshift operater only has 2 numbers and the number on the left shifts however many bits depending on the number on the right
[hr]
This isnt exactly a tutorial but more of a reference
I have Permission from Silent_CJ to make this [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/flhyc1.png[/img]

void example() { absX = absY >> 3; sendMessage(absX); }

String example() { return playerName ? "yes" : "no"; }

item.title: Java Operators and how they are used in the server
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

Purpose; To teach you about the Java Operators and how they can be used in your server.

Difficulty;0/10

[hr]

Well, Lets get started shall we.

Simple Assignment Operator

[ul][li]= Equals[/li][/ul]

How we can use this in a server.

public int example = 0;

[hr]

Arithmetic Operators

[ul][li]+ Add[/li]
[li]- Subtract[/li]
[li]* Multiply[/li]
[li]/ Divide[/li][/ul]

How we use them in a server.

p2.example += 1;

Explanation; This would add 1 to the int example making it change from 0-1 or 1-2 Ect

p2.example -= 1;

Explanation; This would subtract 1 away from int example making it change from 2-1 or 1-0

p2.example *= 2;

Explanation; This would multiply the current number in ‘int example’ by 2 changing it from 5-10 or 10-20

p2.example /= 2;

Explanation; This would divide the current number in ‘int Example’ by 2, changing it from 20-10 or 10-5

[hr]

Equality and Relational Operators

[ul][li]== Equal To[/li]
[li]!= Not Equal To[/li]
[li]> Greater Than[/li]
[li]>= Greater Than or Equal To[/li]
[li]< Less Than[/li]
[li]<= Less than or Equal To[/li][/ul]

How they can be used in a server

else if (p.example == 1);

Explanation; This means if something is equal to something else… so if p.example is 1

else if (p.example != 1);

Explanation; This means if something is not equal to something else… So if p.example is NOT 1.

else if (p.example >= 1);

Explanation; This means if something is More than or Equal to something… so if p.example is 1 or more

else if (p.example > 1);

Explanation; This means if something is more than something… so if p.example is more than 1.

else if (p.example < 3;

Explanation; This means if something is less than something… so if p.example is less than 3

else if (p.example <= 3);

Explanation; This means if something is less than or equal to something… so if p.example is 3 or less.

[hr]

Conditional Operators

[ul][li]&& Conditional-AND[/li]
[li]|| Conditional-OR[/li]
[li]?: Ternary[/li][/ul]

How they can be used in a server.

else if (p.example == 1) && (p.example1 == 2)

Explanation; This means if something is something and something else is something… so if p.example is 1 and p.example1 is 2

else if (p.example == 1) || (p.example1 == 2)

Explanation; This means if something is something or something else is something… so if p example is 1 or p.example1 is 2

String example() { return playerName ? "yes" : "no"; }
Explanation; This is a shorthand method for an If statement. but can only have one input, So if something is example it will be either yes or no.

[hr]

BitShift Operators

[ul][li]<< Signed left shift[/li]
[li]>> Signed right shift[/li]
[li]>>> Unsigned Right shift[/li][/ul]

How they can be used in a server

void example() { absX = absY >> 3; sendMessage(absX); }
Explanation; a Bitshift operater only has 2 numbers and the number on the left shifts however many bits depending on the number on the right

[hr]

This isnt exactly a tutorial but more of a reference

I have Permission from Silent_CJ to make this
